questions.question_text: Which Cisco security solution determines if an endpoint has the latest OS updates and patches installed on the system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is D
with the posture you can check the compliance but not the other way around

Selected Answer: A
I think A fits the description based on ...

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/products/collateral/security/endpoint-security-analytics-built-on-splunk/endpoint-security-analytics-cs.pdf

I would vote for B. 

A is more geared towards Endpoint Analytics and continuous monitoring of behavioral data to detect suspicious or abnormal activities. Its primary role is providing endpoint visibility and proactive threat detection - not ensuring endpoints have the latest OS updates and patches installed as this question is requiring.

C is more of a security tool that ensures endpoints are in compliance with a company's security policies and requirements. 

D reads more like a contractual service (or audit as ntdevera pointed out) between Cisco engineers and the customer network. Its primary role is providing an evaluation of a company's infrastructure, policies and procedures to determine its overall security posture.

D. Security Posture Assessment Service 
used with Cisco ISE posture configurations

Selected Answer: D
In my opinion, D is the best out of a bad bunch of potential answers. 

Don't like A because its more about analytics rather than the posture. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/security/endpoint-security-analytics-built-on-splunk/at-a-glance-c45-742564.html#HowCESAworks

Selected Answer: D
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/about/doing_business/legal/service_descriptions/docs/Security_Posture_Assessment_SPA_Support.pdf

Selected Answer: D
I would stay with D:
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/about/doing_business/legal/service_descriptions/docs/Security_Posture_Assessment_SPA_Support.pdf

Selected Answer: B
https://winncom.ua/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Cisco-Advanced-Malware-Protection-for-Endpoints.pdf

comments.content:
B cannot be correct: exactly from your link:

Cisco AMP for Endpoints Outbreak Control gives you a suite of capabilities to effectively stop the spread of 
malware and malware-related activities, like call-back communications or dropped file execution, without 
waiting for updates from your security vendor. 

... so B make no sense I would stay with D

discussion.content:
I'd go for A. CESA is for endpoint analytics (and has asset OS inventory listed as a feature)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/security/endpoint-security-analytics-built-on-splunk/at-a-glance-c45-742564.html

not D. its a service done by cisco engineers, more of an audit for a client's network done by cisco
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/about/doing_business/legal/service_descriptions/docs/Security_Posture_Assessment_SPA_Support.pdf

questions.question_text: Which open standard creates a framework for sharing threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format?

comments.content: Hello Net4dd. Whats the source of the above definition for STIX?

discussion.content:
D. STIX (Structured Threat Information eXpression) is an open standard that creates a framework for sharing threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format. It enables organizations to share cyber threat intelligence, including information on adversaries, malware, vulnerabilities, and attack patterns, in a structured and consistent way.

OpenIOC (Open Indicator of Compromise) is an open-source framework for representing threat intelligence in a machine-readable format. It is used to describe the characteristics of malware, intrusion attempts, and other malicious activity in a way that can be easily understood and acted upon by security systems and tools.

Selected Answer: D
STIX (Structured Threat Information Expression) is an open standard that provides a framework for sharing cyber threat intelligence in a structured, machine-readable format. It enables organizations to share detailed information about threats, including indicators, tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), to improve collective cybersecurity.

Other options:

A. OpenIOC: A framework for sharing threat indicators but less comprehensive than STIX and not as widely adopted.
Both XML (openioc) and JSON (stix) are machine readable formates. Plus, both openioc and stix seem to be frameworks. Which one is correct then?

Selected Answer: A
CCNP And CCIE Security Core SCOR 350-701 Official Cert Guide.pdf (page 86)

"Open Indicators of Compromise (OpenIOC):
An open framework for sharing threat intelligence
in a machine-digestible format. Learn more at
http://www.openioc.org."

Answer A. No doubt.

My answer is D
Which open standard creates a framework for sharing threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format? OpenIOC, OpenC2, CybOX, STIX

The open standard that creates a framework for sharing threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format is STIX (Structured Threat Information eXpression).
STIX is a JSON-based schema that defines a common format for representing and sharing threat intelligence information. This includes information about adversaries, malware, vulnerabilities, intrusions, and other cyberthreats. STIX is designed to be machine-readable, so that it can be easily shared and processed by computers. This makes it a valuable tool for organizations that need to share threat intelligence with each other to protect their networks.
https://bard.google.com/chat/e3b8e30fe3160083

Selected Answer: A
Prefer A over D. 

"OpenIOC is an open framework, meant for sharing threat intelligence information in a machine-readable format." : https://cyware.com/security-guides/cyber-threat-intelligence/what-is-open-indicators-of-compromise-openioc-framework-ed9d

"STIX provides a common language for describing cyber threat information so it can be shared" : https://stixproject.github.io/about/

Selected Answer: A
As per the official cert guide, definition is clear :
Open Indicators of Compromise (OpenIOC):
An open framework for sharing threat intelligence
in a machine-digestible format.

Structured Threat Information eXpression
(STIX): An express language designed for sharing
of cyber-attack information. STIX details can
contain data such as the IP addresses or domain
names of command-and-control servers (often
referred to C2 or CnC), malware hashes, and so on.
STIX was originally developed by MITRE and is
now maintained by OASIS.

Selected Answer: A
Open Indicators of Compromise
(OpenIOC): An open framework for sharing
threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format.
Source Study Guide Page113

Selected Answer: D
STIX, as it is the open standard that provides a framework for sharing threat intelligence, including indicators of compromise, in a machine-readable format. While OpenIOC is also an open standard for sharing threat intelligence, it is more narrowly focused on describing IOCs specifically, and does not provide a comprehensive framework for sharing all types of threat intelligence.

Selected Answer: A
I prefer A

Selected Answer: A
I first thought it was STIX (which is also open source) but some sites mentions the following : "OpenIOC is an open framework, meant for sharing threat intelligence information in a machine-readable format."

Source : https://cyware.com/educational-guides/cyber-threat-intelligence/what-is-open-indicators-of-compromise-openioc-framework-ed9d

A

Open Indicators Of Compromise (OpenIOC): Open framework for sharing threat intelligence in a machine-digestible format. Learn more at http://www.openioc.org/.
https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2455014&seqNum=3#:~:text=Open%20Indicators%20Of%20Compromise%20(OpenIOC,in%20a%20machine%2Ddigestible%20format.

Selected Answer: D
STIX in my opinion is a framework

choices.D: Cisco AMP for Endpoints prevents connections to malicious destinations, and Cisco Umbrella works at the file level to prevent the initial execution of malware
choices.B: Cisco AMP for Endpoints automatically researches indicators of compromise and confirms threats and Cisco Umbrella does not
choices.C: Cisco AMP for Endpoints prevents, detects, and responds to attacks before damage can be done, and Cisco Umbrella provides the first line of defense against Internet threats
choices.A: Cisco AMP for Endpoints is a cloud-based service, and Cisco Umbrella is not

questions.question_text: What is a difference between Cisco AMP for Endpoints and Cisco Umbrella?

discussion.content: Cisco marketing exam

Selected Answer: C
It's C

https://blogs.cisco.com/security/prevent-detect-and-respond-with-cisco-amp-for-endpoints
https://www.pxosys.com/the-first-line-of-defense-with-cisco-umbrella/

comments.content: Actually looking at the answers again, B is likely irrelevant for AMP and Umbrella, as this is more a Talos function.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Got to know that blog related marketing material! Yet another one I would have got wrong, as I would have chosen B. I don't think that makes me a worse engineer..

Umbrella: https://blogs.cisco.com/networking/cisco-umbrella-wlan-your-first-line-of-defense-on-enterprise-network

Cisco AMP: https://blogs.cisco.com/security/prevent-detect-and-respond-with-cisco-amp-for-endpoints

choices.B: Southbound APIs utilize CLI, SNMP, and RESTCONF
choices.C: Southbound APIs are used to define how SDN controllers integrate with applications
choices.D: Northbound interfaces utilize OpenFlow and OpFlex to integrate with network devices
choices.A: Northbound APIs utilize RESTful API methods such as GET, POST, and DELETE
choices.E: Southbound interfaces utilize device configurations such as VLANs and IP addresses

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
The northbound APIs on an SDN controller enable applications and orchestration systems to program the network and request services from it.

Southbound interfaces are implemented with a Service Abstraction Layer (SAL) Which speak to network devices using SNMP and CLI (Command Line Interface) of the elements that make up the network. The main functions of SAL are:
+ Expose device services and capabilities to apps
+ Determine how to fulfill requested service irrespective of the underlying protocol

Note:
+ An API is a method for one application (program) to exchange data with another application.
+ Interface here refers to the “software interface”, not the physical interfaces.

Selected Answer: AB
Likely A and B - page 11 : https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/global/sr_rs/training-events/2016/cisco-day-2016/pdf/APIC-EM_Vedran_Hafner.pdf

Not C, as a more correct statement would be "Northbound APIs are used to define how SDN controllers integrate with applications"
Not D, as a more correct statement would be "Southbound interfaces utilize OpenFlow and OpFlex.."
Not sure about E

Selected Answer: AB
A&B seem like the logical choices.

questions.question_text: What are two functionalities of northbound and southbound APIs within Cisco SDN architecture? (Choose two.)

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the function of the Python script code snippet for the Cisco ASA REST API?

discussion.content: Correct. POST is used to create (add) a resource on the server.
Add because we are POSTING.

comments.content: Answer is B. Provided answer is right.

choices.A: changes the hostname of the Cisco ASA
choices.B: adds a global rule into policies
choices.D: obtains the saved configuration of the Cisco ASA firewall
choices.C: deletes a global rule from policies
